definition: Zhang Bin (1979-), CCTV sports presenter
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
variant of 彬[bin1]

sentences.english: Zhang Bin walked over, sitting in the Maple" opposite, " uncomfortable?"
sentences.chinese: 张斌走过去，坐在了枫晓的对面，“难受？”

sentences.english: Zhang Bin has lots of thing to do every day, he never plays.
sentences.chinese: 张斌每天要做好多事，他从不玩。

sentences.english: Zhang Bin, he says he is tired.
I am a cold-blooded but I also sad ah, Zhang Bin felt helpless thinking.
sentences.chinese: 我冷血可是我也会难过啊，张斌心里无奈的想着。

sentences.english: Zhang Bin, sometimes you could see straight, can also pierce to the heart of the matter.
sentences.chinese: 张斌，有时你看问题很准，也能一针见血。

sentences.english: Zhang Bin is an anchor for CCTV sports program.
sentences.chinese: 张斌是中央电视台体育节目的主持人。

sentences.english: Feng Xiao shook his head, went to the edge of the table, Zhang Bin handed his chopsticks.
sentences.chinese: 枫晓摇了摇头，走到桌边，张斌递给他筷子。

sentences.english: I can't say, at least not now. Zhang Bin : I believe in you?
sentences.chinese: 我不能说，起码现在不能说。张斌你相信我吗？

definition: Yang Bin (1963-), Chinese-Dutch businessman

Zhang Hua (232-300), Western Jin writer, poet and politician/Zhang Hua (1958-1982), student held up as a martyr after he died saving an old peasant from a septic tank/other Zhang Hua's too numerous to mention
oriole/black-naped oriole (Oriolus chinensis)
Li Zhe, personal name of fourth Tang Emperor Zhongzong 唐中宗[Tang2 Zhong1 zong1] (656-710), reigned 705-710

Hu Jia (1973-), PRC dissident human rights activist
Wang Dan (1969-), Chinese dissident, one of the leaders of the Beijing student democracy movement of 1989
Zhang Dan (1985-), Chinese figure skater
Vanessa-Mae (1978-), Singaporean-born British violinist and skier
Wayne Wang (1949-), Chinese US film director
Yang Jun (571-600), son of the first Sui emperor 楊堅|杨坚[Yang2 Jian1]
Liu Yang (1978-), China's first female astronaut in space (June 16, 2012)
cycle (physics)
Li Jun, fictional character from 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4]
David (name)
